es.utils.functionalinterfaces.throwing

Interface FunctionX<T,U>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Function<T,U>, Serializable
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface FunctionX<T,U>
extends Function<T,U>, Serializable

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        default U apply(T elem)
        Try to call the #applyThrows(Object) method. If any error occurs, throws a RuntimeException.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface Function<T,U>
        Returns:
        the result of the function

      • apply

        default <E extends Exception> U apply(T elem,
                                      Function<Throwable,E> exception)
                               throws E extends Exception
        Try to call the #applyThrows(Object) method. If any error occurs, throws the exception returned by the provided exception.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of Exception to throw
        Parameters:
        elem - the element to consume
        exception - a function that takes a Throwable as input and returns an Exception to throw.
        Returns:
        the result of the function
        Throws:
        E - if the body of this function throws an exception
        E extends Exception

      • applyThrows

       throws Exception
        The body of the FunctionX instance
        Parameters:
        elem - the object in input
        Returns:
        the result of the function
        Throws:
        Exception - allow the implementation to throw any kind of exception
